title: Toyota Motor Appoints CFO Kenta Kon as New CEO
evidence_bullets: Kenta Kon appointed CEO, replacing Koji Sato who becomes vice chairman.
Kon's appointment signals Akio Toyoda's push for profitability and business streamlining.
Toyota raised full-year profit guidance to ¥3.8 trillion despite a 43% net income drop in Q3.
The management shakeup coincides with the Toyota group's push to take Toyota Industries Corp. private.
key_insights: Toyota's leadership change underscores a strategic shift towards enhanced profitability, signaling a tighter grip by Akio Toyoda.
The appointment of a finance specialist as CEO highlights pressure from global competition and geopolitical factors, particularly US tariffs.
The successful privatization of Toyota Industries Corp. could be a significant test of Japan's corporate governance reforms.

title: Mercedes-Benz's S-Class Sedan Rollout Sees Brand Fighting to Defend Luxury Crown
evidence_bullets: Mercedes-Benz's CEO vows to stay the course with a luxury-first strategy, with luxury vehicles now accounting for 15% of sales.
Profit margins on carmaking have narrowed to around 4% from almost 15% since 2022.
Operating profit for 2025 is forecast to more than half, outpacing a 9% decline in global deliveries.
The new S-Class boasts a new V8 combustion engine and advanced AI-powered voice controls.
key_insights: Mercedes-Benz is facing intense pressure to defend its luxury market share with the revamped S-Class, as sales and profit margins decline.
Competition from Chinese rivals like Huawei/JAC's Maextro S800 is increasing, particularly in China, a key market for Mercedes.
The company's luxury-first strategy, aimed at boosting returns and funding the EV shift, appears shaky due to cooling demand and intensified competition.
Advanced technology, including AI-powered voice controls and expansive in-car entertainment, is a key feature of the new S-Class.

title: Porsche weighs scrapping electric models as costs climb
evidence_bullets: Porsche is reconsidering electric versions of its 718 Boxster and Cayman due to rising costs.
The EV course correction could cut operating profit by up to €1.8bn in 2025.
Porsche experienced a 15% delivery increase to 23,670 vehicles in 2024 for the 718 models.
key_insights: Porsche is facing significant cost pressures and potential delays in its EV strategy, leading to a review of electric models.
The company is shifting focus back to combustion engines and hybrids amidst softer demand in China and technical challenges.
Financial impacts include a potential €1.8bn cut to operating profit in 2025 and concerns over US import tariffs.

The rapid growth of Chinese brands poses a significant challenge to European automakers, impacting jobs and economic stability.

government_entities: Ministry of Industry and Information Technology
evidence_bullets: China banned concealed door handles on electric vehicles, effective Jan. 1, 2027.
New rules require mechanical release inside and outside doors following deadly crashes.

key_insights: China is emerging as a global safety standard-setter for EVs, influencing international norms.
The ban on concealed door handles will require significant design changes and potentially increase costs for automakers.
While impacting primarily EVs sold in China, the rule's global influence is significant due to China's market size and export potential.

evidence_bullets: German passenger car market declined 6.6% year-over-year in January 2026.

key_insights: The German auto market is experiencing a slow start to 2026, driven by a significant drop in private buyer demand.
The shift towards alternative propulsion systems, particularly BEVs and hybrids, is accelerating, displacing traditional ICE vehicles.
Significant variations in brand performance highlight the impact of sales incentives and offers on market share.
Geopolitical tensions and economic instability continue to pose risks to the automotive supply chain and market growth.

title: Western European passenger car registrations fall 2.8% in January
evidence_bullets: Western European passenger car market registrations fell 2.7% year over year in January to 860,319 units.
Germany's market declined 6.6% in January, France's fell 6.6%, and Spain's increased 1.1%.
Gasoline car registrations fell 48.9% and diesel by 49.1% in January.
BEV registrations in France grew 52.1% year over year to 30,308 units, a market share of 28.3%.
key_insights: The slight overall decline in Western European car registrations indicates a subdued market start to 2026.
Stricter CO2 emission and weight-based penalties are pushing consumers away from ICE vehicles towards BEVs.
While private customer registrations are sluggish in some markets, fleet sales (rental, company cars) are compensating for declines.
Government incentives for BEVs, especially those with batteries manufactured in Europe, could stimulate demand.

title: VW may discontinue Saveiro production in Brazil as Tukan approaches
evidence_bullets: Volkswagen Saveiro production in Brazil is expected to cease by early 2026.
The Saveiro will be replaced by the new Volkswagen Tukan, slated for release in 2026.
The current Saveiro generation, launched in 1982, is based on the PQ24 platform and has produced approximately 1.9 million units.
The Tukan will utilize the modern MQB A0 architecture and fill a market gap between Fiat Strada and Fiat Toro.
key_insights: Volkswagen is refreshing its Brazilian product lineup by phasing out an older model (Saveiro) for a new platform-based vehicle (Tukan).
This strategic shift indicates Volkswagen's commitment to modernizing its offerings in key emerging markets like Brazil.
The discontinuation of the Saveiro may impact suppliers reliant on its production, while the Tukan's launch presents new opportunities.
The move highlights the ongoing platform consolidation and modernization trend within the automotive industry, even for legacy models.

title: Ford Looks to Hit $30,000 Electric Car Price Target by Shrinking Battery
evidence_bullets: Ford aims for a $30,000 starting price for its next-generation EV line launching next year.
The new EV will be lighter, sleeker, and more electrically efficient, with a range extended by nearly 50 miles.
The automaker reduced the number of parts in the EV line by 20% compared to typical Ford vehicles.

key_insights: Ford is strategically focusing on cost reduction and efficiency to compete with Chinese EV manufacturers.
